settings.title:
per person, double occupancy, including airfare*
based on Apr. 27, 2018 departure

settings.testimonial_content: The cruise and the cruise line is excellent. I had every thing I needed on the ship. The staff is super nice and very helpful. The team is especially helpful. Thank you for making my trip such a memorable one. I would recommend this to all my friends and family. And for myself, I will definitely come back again. Thank you all!

settings.editor: A whole day is dedicated the stunning and unique island of Santorini. Captivating views are not to be missed as your ship approaches this world famous volcanic island. Choose from a variety of excursions- including an island tour featuring Ancient Akrotiri, one of the best preserved ancient cities, thanks to the volcanic ash that once lay thickly upon it. Perhaps enjoy a cable car ride to the top of the island to enjoy the spectacular caldera views and picture post card images of the blue domed churches and white washed cubic houses built into the cliff side.

In the afternoon the ship will dock at the bustling Turkish port of Izmir. A must is the excursion to Ancient Ephesus to see the amazing ruins of this ancient Greek city. Alternatively you may prefer to walk around the colourful town and try your luck at bargaining with the local shopkeepers in the bazaar.

Explore Nafplio, this picturesque seaside town, famous for its Venetian Castle located in the bay, beautiful buildings and sophisticated atmosphere. Another very interesting option is to take part in the optional excursion to Epidaurus. The ancient site of Epidaurus, with ruins of temples devoted to the healing gods and of course the theater. For most travelers Epidaurus is known for the magnificent theater that still stands there – and is still used for plays and other performances.

A whole day is dedicated the stunning and unique island of Santorini. Captivating views are not to be missed as your ship approaches this world famous volcanic island. Choose from a variety of excursions- including an island tour featuring Ancient Akrotiri, one of the best preserved ancient cities, thanks to the volcanic ash that once lay thickly upon it. Perhaps enjoy a cable car ride to the top of the island to enjoy the spectacular caldera views and picture post card images of the blue domed churches and white washed cubic houses built into the cliff side.

settings.testimonial_content: The cruise and the cruise line is excellent. I had every thing I needed on the ship. The staff is super nice and very helpful. The team is especially helpful. Thank you for making my trip such a memorable one. I would recommend this to all my friends and family. And for myself, I will definitely come back again. Thank you all!

tabs.tab_title: Do I need a visa or any other documents?
tabs.tab_content: Zakynthos (Greek: Ζάκυνθος [ˈzacinθos] (About this sound listen)) or Zante (/ˈzɑːnti, -teɪ, ˈzæn-/; from Venetian) is a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. It is the third largest of the Ionian Islands. Zakynthos is a separate regional unit of the Ionian Islands region, and its only municipality. It covers an area of 405.55 km2 (156.6 sq mi) and its coastline is roughly 123 km (76 mi) in length. The name, like all similar names ending in -nthos, is pre-Mycenaean or Pelasgian in origin. In Greek mythology the island was said to be named after Zakynthos, the son of a legendary Arcadian chief Dardanus.

tabs.tab_title: I'm traveling solo. Can you help me find a roommate?
tabs.tab_content: Zakynthos (Greek: Ζάκυνθος [ˈzacinθos] (About this sound listen)) or Zante (/ˈzɑːnti, -teɪ, ˈzæn-/; from Venetian) is a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. It is the third largest of the Ionian Islands. Zakynthos is a separate regional unit of the Ionian Islands region, and its only municipality. It covers an area of 405.55 km2 (156.6 sq mi) and its coastline is roughly 123 km (76 mi) in length. The name, like all similar names ending in -nthos, is pre-Mycenaean or Pelasgian in origin. In Greek mythology the island was said to be named after Zakynthos, the son of a legendary Arcadian chief Dardanus.

tabs.tab_title: Can I bring my kids? Are there any age restrictions?
tabs.tab_content: Zakynthos (Greek: Ζάκυνθος [ˈzacinθos] (About this sound listen)) or Zante (/ˈzɑːnti, -teɪ, ˈzæn-/; from Venetian) is a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. It is the third largest of the Ionian Islands. Zakynthos is a separate regional unit of the Ionian Islands region, and its only municipality. It covers an area of 405.55 km2 (156.6 sq mi) and its coastline is roughly 123 km (76 mi) in length. The name, like all similar names ending in -nthos, is pre-Mycenaean or Pelasgian in origin. In Greek mythology the island was said to be named after Zakynthos, the son of a legendary Arcadian chief Dardanus.

tabs.tab_title: What should I know about Greece?
tabs.tab_content: Zakynthos (Greek: Ζάκυνθος [ˈzacinθos] (About this sound listen)) or Zante (/ˈzɑːnti, -teɪ, ˈzæn-/; from Venetian) is a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. It is the third largest of the Ionian Islands. Zakynthos is a separate regional unit of the Ionian Islands region, and its only municipality. It covers an area of 405.55 km2 (156.6 sq mi) and its coastline is roughly 123 km (76 mi) in length. The name, like all similar names ending in -nthos, is pre-Mycenaean or Pelasgian in origin. In Greek mythology the island was said to be named after Zakynthos, the son of a legendary Arcadian chief Dardanus.

settings.description_text: The most famous landmark of the island is the Navagio beach. It is a cove on the northwest shore, isolated by high cliffs and accessible only by boat.
The theatre is admired for its, which permit almost perfect intelligibility of unamplified spoken words from the proscenium or skēnē to all 14,000 spectators.
